item.description:
@bigdana wrote:

eyeownyew:

Even with garbage collectors, all of those variable names are a massive waste of memory…

It’s in my server i’m developing, and the code works flawlessly, Why bitch?

krackkid:

Total leech.

yeah, you got me. 100% leeched. TROLLLLLLL!

item.title: 562 Server NPC Dialogue(teleports)
item.dc:creator: @bigdana bigdana
item.description:
@bigdana wrote:

Difficulty: 0/10

This is a very short tutorial, but can help thousands.

Open NpcPackethandler.java, Search [QUOTE]if(npc.getId() == 8517) {[/QUOTE] Under 8517, Add

[QUOTE] if(npc.getId() == 8443) { //lucien //npc speaking
p.turnTemporarilyTo(npc);
npc.turnTemporarilyTo§;
p.getActionSender().sendChatboxInterface(241);
p.getActionSender().animateInterface(9827, 241, 2);
p.getActionSender().sendNPCOnInterface(8443, 241, 2);
p.getActionSender().sendString(“Lucien”, 241, 3);
p.getActionSender().sendString(“Greetings, Would you like to be teleported some-where fierce?”, 241, 4);
p.thunderscapeTutor = 999;
}[/QUOTE]
Understanding: [QUOTE]Id: 8443 is Lucien. This starts the conversation.[/QUOTE]

Close NpcPackethandler.java, Now open DialogueOptions.java, Search [QUOTE]== 241) {[/QUOTE] under the last [QUOTE]}[/QUOTE] add,

[QUOTE]//Lucien teleports option
if (player.thunderscapeTutor == 999) {
player.getActionSender().sendChatboxInterface(241);
player.getActionSender().animateInterface(9827, 241, 2);
player.getActionSender().sendPlayerOnInterface(241, 2);
player.getActionSender().sendString(""+player.getDisplayName(), 241, 3);
player.getActionSender().sendString(“I think i’m strong enough to fight these creatures?”, 241, 4);
player.thunderscapeTutor = 1000;
break;
}
if (player.thunderscapeTutor == 1000) {
player.getActionSender().sendString(“Select a Teleport”, 230, 1);
player.getActionSender().sendString(“Balance Elemental”, 230, 2);
player.getActionSender().sendString(“Phoenix”, 230, 3);
player.getActionSender().sendString(“Bork”, 230, 4);
player.getActionSender().sendChatboxInterface(230);
player.thunderscapeTutor = 1001;
}
//lucient teleports option[/QUOTE]

Now to make it teleport places.

Search, [QUOTE]case 4:[/QUOTE] under it, add

[QUOTE]if (player.thunderscapeTutor == 1001) {
player.getActionSender().sendCloseChatboxInterface();
player.getTele().thunderscapeTelePlayer(player,3107 ,5532 , 0, 2);
player.thunderscapeTutor = 5;
}[/QUOTE]
now Search, [QUOTE]case 3:[/QUOTE] under it, add

[QUOTE]if (player.thunderscapeTutor == 1001) {
player.getActionSender().sendCloseChatboxInterface();
player.getTele().thunderscapeTelePlayer(player,2850 ,9637 , 0, 2);
player.thunderscapeTutor = 5;
}[/QUOTE]
next Search, [QUOTE]case 2: [/QUOTE] under it, add

[QUOTE] if (player.thunderscapeTutor == 1001) {
player.getActionSender().sendCloseChatboxInterface();
player.getTele().thunderscapeTelePlayer(player,2540, 5778 , 0, 2);
player.thunderscapeTutor = 5;
}[/QUOTE]

Case 2: ----> action button, which equals Balance Elemental equals teleporting to Balance Elemental.
Case 3: ----> action button, which equals Phoenix equals teleporting to Phoenix.
case 4: ----> action button, which equals Bork equals teleporting to Bork.

My Dialogue is completely different from yours, but don’t sweat it.

Just change the code, [QUOTE]player.TOYOURCODE = 5;[/QUOTE] and [QUOTE]if (player.TOYOURCODE == 1001) {[/QUOTE]

Read full topic
